## Practice Exercises

### 1. Complete the words based on the meanings provided:

```{=html}
<style>
  table {
    border-collapse: collapse;
    width: 100%;
    max-width: 700px;
  }
  th, td {
    border: 1px solid #ccc;
    padding: 10px;
    text-align: left;
  }
  input {
    width: 100%;
    padding: 6px;
  }
  .correct {
    color: green;
    font-weight: bold;
  }
  .wrong {
    color: red;
    font-weight: bold;
  }
  button {
    margin-top: 10px;
    padding: 8px 14px;
    font-size: 14px;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
</style>

<table>
  <tr>
    <th>Meaning</th>
    <th>Complete the word</th>
    <th>Feedback</th>
  </tr>

  <tr>
    <td>Not afraid of danger</td>
    <td><input id="a1" placeholder="Type the word"></td>
    <td id="f1"></td>
  </tr>

  <tr>
    <td>Cannot be seen</td>
    <td><input id="a2" placeholder="Type the word"></td>
    <td id="f2"></td>
  </tr>

  <tr>
    <td>Bad people or characters</td>
    <td><input id="a3" placeholder="Type the word"></td>
    <td id="f3"></td>
  </tr>

  <tr>
    <td>Very smart</td>
    <td><input id="a4" placeholder="Type the word"></td>
    <td id="f4"></td>
  </tr>

  <tr>
    <td>A hidden real identity</td>
    <td><input id="a5" placeholder="Type the word"></td>
    <td id="f5"></td>
  </tr>
</table>

<button onclick="checkAnswers()">Check Answers</button>

<script>
  function checkAnswers() {
    const answers = [
      "brave",
      "invisible",
      "villains",
      "intelligent",
      "secret identity"
    ];

    answers.forEach((correct, i) => {
      const input = document.getElementById("a" + (i + 1)).value
        .toLowerCase()
        .trim();
      const feedback = document.getElementById("f" + (i + 1));

      if (input === correct) {
        feedback.innerHTML = "✔ Correct";
        feedback.className = "correct";
      } else {
        feedback.innerHTML = "✘ Wrong";
        feedback.className = "wrong";
      }
    });
  }
</script>
```
